This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ESAC-LTSN.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-01-29T11:59:27Z Samantha Faulkner 2015-01-29T11:59:20+00:00 2015-01-29T11:59:20+00:00 [UKeiG] Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball, London, 24 March https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;f0467656.1501 Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball<br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br>Date: Tuesday, 24 March, 2015 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>This one-day workshop explores the definitions, economics and growth of Open Access and explores practicalities, challenges and opportunities for the future. Delegates will be encouraged to raise questions and debate issues of immediate concern throughout the day. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2015-01-29T11:58:16+00:00 2015-01-29T11:58:16+00:00 UKeiG Early Career Award - Call for Nominations https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;723d7765.1501 The UKeiG Early Career Award is offered to early-career professionals who are both members of CILIP and who have no more than five years work experience since gaining their professional qualification The award will be presented each year to the individual who has made the most inspirational or enterprising difference - either in their workplace or to the wider profession. UKeiG is looking for a level of professional commitment that has resulted in achievements beyond what was expected of them in the workplace. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2015-01-19T15:06:24+00:00 2015-01-19T15:06:24+00:00 [UKeiG] Copyright Update: making sense of copyright reforms - Emily Stannard, London, 2 March https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;19407105.1501 Copyright Update: making sense of copyright reforms - Emily Stannard<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Monday, 2 March, 2015 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>2014 saw some major changes to UK copyright law which are having a significant impact on the work of information professionals in all sectors.<br>This one day, interactive workshop will bring attendees up to date on developments in copyright, specifically the changes to UK law and ongoing issues at EU level, and will provide a range of solutions for everyone who uses information resources in their day to day work.<br> [...] Samantha Faulkner 2015-01-19T14:10:38+00:00 2015-01-19T14:10:38+00:00 [UKeiG] New UKeiG Award for early-career professionals https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;c8902ae4.1501 With the UKeiG Early Career Award, our second award for individuals at the start of their professional life, UKeiG wishes to celebrate extra-ordinary and inspirational enterprise.<br><br>Offered to early-career professionals who are both members of CILIP and who have no more than five years work experience since gaining their qualification, the award will be presented each year to the individual who has made the most inspirational or enterprising difference - either in their workplace or to the wider profession. UKeiG is looking for a level of professional commitment that has resulted in achievements beyond what was expected of them in [...] Samantha Faulkner 2015-01-07T13:43:32+00:00 2015-01-07T13:43:32+00:00 [UKeiG] Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter, London, 25th February https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;2bce64cd.1501 Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 25 February, 2015 - 10:00 - 16:30<br><br>Comments from previous sessions:<br><br>"This has been a fantastic course - I have learnt so much and gained more confidence around a number of digital marketing tools and how to use them effectively." [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-11-13T09:41:03+00:00 2014-11-13T09:41:03+00:00 [UKeiG] Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter, London, 3 December https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;d8241329.1411 Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 3 December, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>There is an increasing array of emerging technologies which can be used to successfully market your service.<br><br>Moving beyond the social network basics, this course will look at how to identify which technologies will be useful for marketing your organisation, how to use them effectively, and tips, tricks and general best-practice for marketing online. Topics will include marketing with video, viral marketing, mastering geolocation (such as FourSquare), mobile apps, publishing online, getting the most [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-10-24T11:05:21+00:00 2014-10-24T11:05:21+00:00 [UKeiG] Making Your Message Stick: presentation skills for information professionals - Ned Potter, London 26 November https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;2f973c6a.1410 Making Your Message Stick: presentation skills for information professionals - Ned Potter<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 26 November, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>As the requirement to present to an audience and create presentations for use online becomes ubiquitous across many different information roles, this course equips delegates with the skills and confidence they need to excel at it. [...] SEEC Office 2014-10-15T10:15:37+01:00 2014-10-15T10:15:37+01:00 NUCCAT/SEEC Annual Conference, Credit:Unfinished Business https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;89e919c3.1410 ** APOLOGIES FOR CROSS POSTING**<br><br>Dear Colleagues<br><br>Please see below details of this joint conference of the Northern<br>Universities Consortium (NUCCAT) and the Southern England Credit Consortium<br>(SEEC).<br><br>CREDIT: UNFINISHED BUSINESS<br><br>Date: Wednesday 19th November 2014<br>Venue: Aston Business School, Conference Centre, Conference Aston,<br>Birmingham<br><br>On 19th November the Northern Universities Consortium (NUCCAT) and the<br>Southern England Credit Consortium (SEEC), supported by the Centre for<br>Recording Achievement (CRA) and the UK Credit Forum (UKCF), will host their<br>joint 2014 conference on the theme of "Credit: unfinished business" at the<br>Aston Conference Centre. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-10-03T08:22:56+00:00 2014-10-03T08:22:56+00:00 [UKeiG] Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter, London, 3 December 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;36917131.1410 Digital Marketing Toolkit - Ned Potter<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 3 December, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>There is an increasing array of emerging technologies which can be used to successfully market your service.<br><br>Moving beyond the social network basics, this course will look at how to identify which technologies will be useful for marketing your organisation, how to use them effectively, and tips, tricks and general best-practice for marketing online. Topics will include marketing with video, viral marketing, mastering geolocation (such as FourSquare), mobile apps, publishing online, getting the most [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-29T08:32:57+00:00 2014-09-29T08:32:57+00:00 [UKeIG] Getting to grips with developing and managing e-book collections: an introduction - Chris Armstrong & Ray Lonsdale, London, 20 November https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;c4b0e729.1409 Getting to grips with developing and managing e-book collections: an introduction - Chris Armstrong & Ray Lonsdale<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Thursday, 20 November, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>This introductory course is designed to support librarians who are beginning to set up e-book collections. In the last 15 years, there has been an unprecedented growth in the publishing of e-books with an increasing array of different types available for all sectors. The programme will give you the opportunity to explore different e-books, including a range of commercially-published and free reference works, [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-18T11:52:18+00:00 2014-09-18T11:52:18+00:00 CORRECTION [UKeiG] Social Searching - Karen Blakeman, London, Tuesday 28 OCTOBER https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;2d73e57e.1409 *****CORECTION - change of date*****<br><br>Social Searching - Karen Blakeman<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Tuesday, 28 October, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>'Social' has become an integral part of search. Companies use social and professional networks to market their services and stay in touch with existing and potential customers. Conference highlights, presentations and videos are shared across multiple platforms. Researchers use social media to discuss, promote and share their work. And many people use their connections to share information and ask questions. Google and Bing include social media in their results but [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-18T10:27:21+00:00 2014-09-18T10:27:21+00:00 [UKeiG] Social Searching - Karen Blakeman, London, Tuesday 28 September https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;bae8b770.1409 Social Searching - Karen Blakeman<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Tuesday, 28 October, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>'Social' has become an integral part of search. Companies use social and professional networks to market their services and stay in touch with existing and potential customers. Conference highlights, presentations and videos are shared across multiple platforms. Researchers use social media to discuss, promote and share their work. And many people use their connections to share information and ask questions. Google and Bing include social media in their results but do not cover everything so [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-17T10:45:17+00:00 2014-09-17T10:45:17+00:00 [UKeiG] Developing an Organisational Search Strategy - Martin White, London, 15 October https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;9263a01e.1409 Developing an Organisational Search Strategy - Martin White<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 15 October, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>In most organisations website search and enterprise search applications are managed on an ad hoc basis, with limited staff and budget resources and no clear objectives other than "We want it to be as good as Google!". As with any corporate resource, search objectives and resources need to be set out in a strategy document that also reflects the relationship between content quality and search quality. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-17T08:43:24+00:00 2014-09-17T08:43:24+00:00 [UKeiG] Strategies for Adopting Collaborative Working Technologies - Dion Lindsay, London, 22 October https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;22ff5a2a.1409 Strategies for Adopting Collaborative Working Technologies - Dion Lindsay<br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br>Date: Wednesday, 22 October, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>Many employers feel collaboration in their organisation is not good enough. But there is a risk that the adoption of collaborative technology, without either strong evidence of current activity or a model of how collaboration works, will have little impact on organisational performance. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-11T08:51:54+00:00 2014-09-11T08:51:54+00:00 UKeiG is pleased to announce the winner of the 2014 Tony Kent Strix Award https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;53c57dca.1409 UKeiG, in association with the International Society for Knowledge Organisation UK and the British Computer Society Information Retrieval Specialist Group, is delighted to announce that this year's winner of the Tony Kent Strix Award is Dr Susan T Dumais, Distinguished Scientist and Deputy Managing Director as well as Manager of the Context, Learning, and User Experience for Search (CLUES) Group, Microsoft Research, Redmond, WA 98052 USA. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-11T08:49:47+00:00 2014-09-11T08:49:47+00:00 [UKeiG] Content Curation: making sense of a complex world - Steve Dale, London, 25th September - LAST CHANCE TO BOOK https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;e9363ef3.1409 Are you, your colleagues, clients or service users drowning in information? Be quick if you want to attend this valuable new course.<br><br>Content Curation: making sense of a complex world - Steve Dale<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Thursday, 25 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>The Internet fire hose is ubiquitous and overwhelming, with the result that we're often overwhelmed with raw, unfiltered, context-free information. This is fuelling a demand for new content organisation and consumption methods in order to find meaningful and relevant information in these fast-moving data flows. Relevant and [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-09-04T09:09:01+00:00 2014-09-04T09:09:01+00:00 [UKeiG] Copyright Update: making sense of copyright reforms - Emily Stannard, London, 24 October https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;e00449c5.1409 Copyright Update: making sense of copyright reforms - Emily Stannard<br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br>Date: Friday, 24 October, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>Spring 2014 saw major changes to UK copyright law which will have a significant impact on the work of information professionals in all sectors.<br><br>This one day, interactive workshop will bring attendees up to date on developments in copyright, specifically the changes to UK law and ongoing issues at EU level, and will provide a range of solutions for everyone who uses information resources in their day to day work. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-28T08:57:30+00:00 2014-08-28T08:57:30+00:00 [UKeiG] Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball, London, 23 September https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;cfdfbe39.1408 Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball<br><br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br><br>Date: Tuesday, 23 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>This one-day workshop explores the definitions, economics and growth of Open Access and explores practicalities, challenges and opportunities for the future. Delegates will be encouraged to raise questions and debate issues of immediate concern throughout the day. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-18T13:42:21+00:00 2014-08-18T13:42:21+00:00 Using Multimedia Tools to Present Information - Phil Bradley, London, 29 September https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;c022c68d.1408 Using Multimedia Tools to Present Information - Phil Bradley<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Monday, 29 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>This one-day, hands-on workshop explores tools that can be used to present information in ways that are not purely textual. Delegates will have plenty of opportunity to practice throughout the day. [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-15T13:15:06+00:00 2014-08-15T13:15:06+00:00 [UKeiG] Content Curation: making sense of a complex world - Steve Dale, London, 25th September https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;e55c705a.1408 Content Curation: making sense of a complex world - Steve Dale<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Thursday, 25 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>The Internet fire hose is ubiquitous and overwhelming, with the result that we're often overwhelmed with raw, unfiltered, context-free information. This is fuelling a demand for new content organisation and consumption methods in order to find meaningful and relevant information in these fast-moving data flows. Relevant and decision-ready information is becoming a valuable commodity in its own right, and many organisations are beginning to appreciate the roles and skills [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-08T09:36:19+00:00 2014-08-08T09:36:19+00:00 [UKeiG] Research Data Management for Information Professionals - Andrew Cox and Eddy Verbaan, London, 24 September https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;778f8f5e.1408 Research Data Management for Information Professionals - Andrew Cox and Eddy Verbaan<br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br>Date: Wednesday, 24 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>There is an increasing understanding that data collected during research needs to be managed more carefully. It is in researchers' own interests to do so, and increasingly funders also mandate data planning. The scale, diversity and fragility of digital data make this challenging. Universities are beginning to develop a support infrastructure that will help improve research data management. Some libraries are already beginning to play a key role in [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-06T09:59:00+00:00 2014-08-06T09:59:00+00:00 [UKeiG] Digital Workplaces: vision and reality - Martin White, London, 24 September 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;7d0b858f.1408 Digital Workplaces: vision and reality - Martin White<br>Venue: Euston House, 24 Eversholt Street, London NW1 1AD<br>Date: Wednesday, 24 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>There is a lot of interest in 'digital workplaces' as a potential vision for not only how organisations can work more efficiently and effectively but also build stronger digital working relationships with other organisations, for example in the support of open innovation. This course will set out the characteristics of a digital workplace, provide an overview of some of the enabling technologies (cloud computing, mobile and collaboration) and then focus in on [...] Samantha Faulkner 2014-08-04T10:49:53+00:00 2014-08-04T10:49:53+00:00 [UKeiG] Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ESAC-LTSN;4c630f71.1408 Open Access: How it will change your (professional) life - David Ball<br><br>Venue: CILIP, 7 Ridgmount Street, London, WC1E 7AE<br><br>Date: Tuesday, 23 September, 2014 - 09:30 - 16:30<br><br>Course Outline:<br>This one-day workshop explores the definitions, economics and growth of Open Access and explores practicalities, challenges and opportunities for the future.
